titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Stanley Karnow papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tanya Yule

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-20T08:16-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Added inventory of boxes 1-79, transferred from JFK Library.

did.abstract: Notes, news dispatches, interview transcripts, government documents, studies, reports, printed matter, and photographs relating to political conditions and international relations primarily in Asia, and especially in China, Vietnam and the Philippines, and to Asian American communities. Used as research materials for books by Stanley Karnow.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 80-116 may not be used without permission of the Archivist. Remainder of collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Stanley Karnow papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2017.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American journalist and author. Correspondent for Time, Life, The Saturday Evening Post, The London Observer, and The Washington Post (1959-1974).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Notes, news dispatches, interview transcripts, government documents, studies, reports, printed matter, and photographs relating to political conditions and international relations primarily in Asia, and especially in China, Vietnam and the Philippines, and to Asian American communities. Used as research materials for books by Stanley Karnow.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Boxes 1-79 were transferred from the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and have retained their order. Boxes 80-116, Asian American Research Materials and Philippines Research Materials, have maintained their original physical order; a portion of this increment had been intellectually organized to maintain a subseries level arrangement. The original series and subseries titles were maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notebooks created and used by Karnow during his work as a news correspondent from 1952 to 1982, spanning his career as a journalist in France, Algeria, Vietnam, and China. Subjects covered include the Middle East, the Algerian War, the Vietnam War, and the Chinese Cultural Revolution. Notebooks contain interview notes, field notes, research, and travel information, and are arranged chronologically. Any undated notebooks are arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Files created and used by Karnow during his work as a news correspondent from 1952 to 1982, including dispatches, press releases, clippings, research materials, and notes, arranged alphabetically by subject then chronologically. Field dispatches are chiefly located in "[Dispatches and related materials]," however some dispatches are cross-filed in the corresponding subject file. Note that items within "[Dispatches and related materials]" folders were kept in their original reverse chronological order. The bulk of this series covers Karnowâs research on China from 1964 to 1974, particularly issues related to the Chinese Cultural Revolution. Files from the late 1970s to the 1980s cover issues in Europe, the Middle East, the United States, and Morocco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Approximately 100 8" x 10" research photographs of soldiers, politicians, and war.
